title: Contributor Covenant Code of Conduct
text: members, contributors, leaders pledge make participation community harassment-free experience everyone, regardless age, body size, visible invisible disability, ethnicity, sex characteristics, gender identity expression, level experience, education, socio-economic status, nationality, personal appearance, race, caste, color, religion, sexual identity orientation. pledge act interact ways contribute open, welcoming, diverse, inclusive, healthy community.

title: Contributor Covenant Code of Conduct
text: Examples behavior contributes positive environment community include: Demonstrating empathy kindness toward people respectful differing opinions, viewpoints, experiences Giving gracefully accepting constructive feedback Accepting responsibility apologizing affected mistakes, learning experience Focusing best just us individuals, overall community Examples unacceptable behavior include: use sexualized language imagery, sexual attention advances kind Trolling, insulting derogatory comments, personal political attacks Public private harassment Publishing others’ private information, physical email address, without explicit permission conduct reasonably considered inappropriate professional setting

title: Contributor Covenant Code of Conduct
text: Community leaders responsible clarifying enforcing standards acceptable behavior take appropriate fair corrective action response behavior deem inappropriate, threatening, offensive, harmful. Community leaders right responsibility remove, edit, reject comments, commits, code, wiki edits, issues, contributions aligned Code Conduct, communicate reasons moderation decisions appropriate.

title: Contributor Covenant Code of Conduct
text: Code Conduct applies within community spaces, also applies individual officially representing community public spaces. Examples representing community include using official e-mail address, posting via official social media account, acting appointed representative online offline event.

title: Contributor Covenant Code of Conduct
text: Instances abusive, harassing, otherwise unacceptable behavior may reported community leaders responsible enforcement sshafee@isrt.ac.bd. complaints reviewed investigated promptly fairly. community leaders obligated respect privacy security reporter incident.

title: Contributor Covenant Code of Conduct
text: Community leaders follow Community Impact Guidelines determining consequences action deem violation Code Conduct:

title: Contributor Covenant Code of Conduct
text: Community Impact: Use inappropriate language behavior deemed unprofessional unwelcome community. Consequence: private, written warning community leaders, providing clarity around nature violation explanation behavior inappropriate. public apology may requested.

title: Contributor Covenant Code of Conduct
text: Community Impact: Demonstrating pattern violation community standards, including sustained inappropriate behavior, harassment individual, aggression toward disparagement classes individuals. Consequence: permanent ban sort public interaction within community.

title: Contributor Covenant Code of Conduct
text: Code Conduct adapted Contributor Covenant, version 2.1, available https://www.contributor-covenant.org/version/2/1/code_of_conduct.html. Community Impact Guidelines inspired [Mozilla’s code conduct enforcement ladder][https://github.com/mozilla/inclusion]. answers common questions code conduct, see FAQ https://www.contributor-covenant.org/faq. title: Calculate Median Odds Ratio From a Fitted Multilevel Binary Logistic Model
text: goal MOR provides post-estimation function calculate Median Odds Ratio (MOR) multilevel binary logistic regression model fit. Currently package provides median odds ratio case two-level random intercept model three-level random intercept model model fitted using R packages lme4 GLMMadaptive glmmTMB.

title: Calculate Median Odds Ratio From a Fitted Multilevel Binary Logistic Model
text: MOR CRAN yet. can install development version MOR GitHub :

title: Calculate Median Odds Ratio From a Fitted Multilevel Binary Logistic Model
code: library(MOR)  data("mlm_data1", package = "MOR") data("mlm_data2", package = "MOR")  # fitting two level random intercept model using lme4 package model <- lme4::glmer(Yij ~ X1c + X2b + (1 | cluster),   family = "binomial", data = mlm_data1 )  mor(model) #> # A tibble: 1 × 4 #>   term        estimate ci_lower ci_upper #>   <chr>          <dbl>    <dbl>    <dbl> #> 1 mor_cluster     4.42     3.51     5.58 ## to get 90% CI mor(model, conf.level = 0.90) #> # A tibble: 1 × 4 #>   term        estimate ci_lower ci_upper #>   <chr>          <dbl>    <dbl>    <dbl> #> 1 mor_cluster     4.42     3.64     5.38  # fitting two level random intercept model using GLMMadaptive package model1 <- GLMMadaptive::mixed_model(   fixed = Yij ~ X1c + X2b,   random = ~ 1 | cluster,   family = binomial("logit"), data = mlm_data1 )  mor(model1) #> # A tibble: 1 × 4 #>   term        estimate ci_lower ci_upper #>   <chr>          <dbl>    <dbl>    <dbl> #> 1 mor_cluster     4.43     3.51     5.60   # fitting two level random intercept model using glmmTMB package model2 <- glmmTMB::glmmTMB(Yij ~ X1c + X2b + (1 | cluster),   family = binomial("logit"), data = mlm_data1 )  mor(model2) #> # A tibble: 1 × 4 #>   term        estimate ci_lower ci_upper #>   <chr>          <dbl>    <dbl>    <dbl> #> 1 mor_cluster     4.42     3.50     5.59   # fitting three level random intercept model using glmmTMB package model3 <- glmmTMB::glmmTMB(Yijk ~ X1c + X2b + (1 | ea) + (1 | ea:hh),   family = "binomial", data = mlm_data2 )  mor(model3) #> # A tibble: 2 × 4 #>   term      estimate ci_lower ci_upper #>   <chr>        <dbl>    <dbl>    <dbl> #> 1 mor_ea:hh     4.21     3.78     4.68 #> 2 mor_ea        6.29     5.38     7.36   # fitting three level random intercept model using lme4 package model4 <- lme4::glmer(Yijk ~ X1c + X2b + (1 | ea) + (1 | ea:hh),   family = "binomial", data = mlm_data2 )  mor(model4) #> # A tibble: 2 × 4 #>   term      estimate ci_lower ci_upper #>   <chr>        <dbl>    <dbl>    <dbl> #> 1 mor_ea:hh     4.21     3.78     4.68 #> 2 mor_ea        6.29     5.38     7.36 ## to get 90% CI mor(model4, conf.level = 0.90) #> # A tibble: 2 × 4 #>   term      estimate ci_lower ci_upper #>   <chr>        <dbl>    <dbl>    <dbl> #> 1 mor_ea:hh     4.21     3.85     4.60 #> 2 mor_ea        6.29     5.52     7.18

title: Calculate Median Odds Ratio From a Fitted Multilevel Binary Logistic Model
text: Please note MOR project released Contributor Code Conduct. contributing project, agree abide terms.

what: MOR: Calculate Median Odds Ratio From a Fitted Multilevel Binary Logistic Model — MOR-package
title: MOR: Calculate Median Odds Ratio From a Fitted Multilevel Binary Logistic Model — MOR-package
text: Provides postestimation function calculate Median Odds Ratio (MOR) multilevel binary logistic regression model fit. Currently package provides Median Odds Ratio case two-level random intercept model three-level random intercept model model fitted using R packages 'lme4', 'GLMMadaptive' 'glmmTMB'.

title: MOR: Calculate Median Odds Ratio From a Fitted Multilevel Binary Logistic Model — MOR-package
text: Maintainer: Shafayet Khan Shafee sshafee@isrt.ac.bd

title: A Simulated Multilevel Data — mlm_data1
text: data contains data 100 clusters cluster contains 50 individuals.

title: A Simulated Multilevel Data — mlm_data1
text: tibble 5000 rows 5 variables: cluster Cluster ID id Individual ID X1c continuous covariate X2b binary covariate Yij Response Variable

title: A Simulated Multilevel Data — mlm_data2
text: data contains data 70 Enumeration Areas (EA) EA contains 30 Households (HH) HH 5 individuals.

title: A Simulated Multilevel Data — mlm_data2
text: tibble 10,500 rows 6 variables: ea Enumeration Area ID hh Household ID id Individual ID X1c continuous covariate X2b binary covariate Yijk Response Variable

what: Calculate Median Odds Ratio from a fitted multilevel binary logistic model object. — mor
title: Calculate Median Odds Ratio from a fitted multilevel binary logistic model object. — mor
text: Calculate Median Odds Ratio fitted multilevel binary logistic model object.

title: Calculate Median Odds Ratio from a fitted multilevel binary logistic model object. — mor
Calculate Median Odds Ratio from a fitted multilevel binary logistic model object. — mor
text: object glmerMod object created lme4::glmer() MixMod object created GLMMadaptive::mixed_model() glmmTMB object created glmmTMB::glmmTMB(). See Details. conf.int Logical indicating whether include confidence interval using Delta method tidied output. Defaults TRUE. conf.level confidence level use confidence interval conf.int = TRUE. Must strictly greater 0 less 1. Defaults 0.95, corresponds 95 percent confidence interval. ... Currently used.

title: Calculate Median Odds Ratio from a fitted multilevel binary logistic model object. — mor
text: tibble columns, term:      Name estimate estimate:  Estimate Median Odds Ratio (MOR) ci_lower:  Lower bound confidence interval MOR ci_upper:  Upper bound confidence interval MOR

title: Calculate Median Odds Ratio from a fitted multilevel binary logistic model object. — mor
text: Median Odds Ratio (MOR) suggested measure heterogeneity quantifies cluster heterogeneity facilitates direct comparison covariate effects magnitude heterogeneity terms well-known odds ratios (Larsen et al. 2000; Larsen Merlo 2005)

title: Calculate Median Odds Ratio from a fitted multilevel binary logistic model object. — mor
text: Larsen K, Merlo J (2005). “Appropriate assessment neighborhood effects individual health: integrating random fixed effects multilevel logistic regression.” American journal epidemiology, 161(1), 81--88. Larsen K, Petersen JH, Budtz-Jørgensen E, Endahl L (2000). “Interpreting parameters logistic regression model random effects.” Biometrics, 56(3), 909--914.

title: Calculate Median Odds Ratio from a fitted multilevel binary logistic model object. — mor
code: data("mlm_data1") data("mlm_data2")  # fitting two level random intercept model using lme4 package model <- lme4::glmer(Yij ~ X1c + X2b + (1 | cluster),   family = "binomial", data = mlm_data1 )  mor(model) #> # A tibble: 1 × 4 #>   term        estimate ci_lower ci_upper #>   <chr>          <dbl>    <dbl>    <dbl> #> 1 mor_cluster     4.42     3.51     5.58 ## to get 90% CI mor(model, conf.level = 0.90) #> # A tibble: 1 × 4 #>   term        estimate ci_lower ci_upper #>   <chr>          <dbl>    <dbl>    <dbl> #> 1 mor_cluster     4.42     3.64     5.38  # fitting two level random intercept model using GLMMadaptive package model1 <- GLMMadaptive::mixed_model(   fixed = Yij ~ X1c + X2b,   random = ~ 1 | cluster,   family = binomial("logit"),   data = mlm_data1 )  mor(model1) #> # A tibble: 1 × 4 #>   term        estimate ci_lower ci_upper #>   <chr>          <dbl>    <dbl>    <dbl> #> 1 mor_cluster     4.43     3.51     5.60  # fitting two level random intercept model using glmmTMB package model2 <- glmmTMB::glmmTMB(Yij ~ X1c + X2b + (1 | cluster),   family = binomial("logit"), data = mlm_data1 )  mor(model2) #> # A tibble: 1 × 4 #>   term        estimate ci_lower ci_upper #>   <chr>          <dbl>    <dbl>    <dbl> #> 1 mor_cluster     4.42     3.50     5.59  # fitting three level random intercept model using glmmTMB package model3 <- glmmTMB::glmmTMB(Yijk ~ X1c + X2b + (1 | ea) + (1 | ea:hh),   family = "binomial", data = mlm_data2 )  mor(model3) #> # A tibble: 2 × 4 #>   term      estimate ci_lower ci_upper #>   <chr>        <dbl>    <dbl>    <dbl> #> 1 mor_ea:hh     4.21     3.78     4.68 #> 2 mor_ea        6.29     5.38     7.36  # fitting three level random intercept model using lme4 package model4 <- lme4::glmer(Yijk ~ X1c + X2b + (1 | ea) + (1 | ea:hh),   family = "binomial", data = mlm_data2 )   mor(model4) #> # A tibble: 2 × 4 #>   term      estimate ci_lower ci_upper #>   <chr>        <dbl>    <dbl>    <dbl> #> 1 mor_ea:hh     4.21     3.78     4.68 #> 2 mor_ea        6.29     5.38     7.36

title: MOR 0.2.3
text: Removed argument get SE MOR, since mistakes implementation get SE MOR, afraid , CI correctly calculated using Delta method.

title: MOR 0.2.0

title: MOR 0.1.0
text: Created package. Created mor generic function. Added mor method MixMod (model object GLMMadaptive package) Added mor method glmmTMB (model object glmmTMB package)
